alert.note: Alert for Bureau; La Salle; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 11:00AM CST until February 28 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at La Salle affecting La Salle, Bureau and Putnam Counties. For the Illinois River (Upper)...including Morris, Ottawa, La Salle...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Illinois River at La Salle. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Lower parking lot at Starved Rock State Park is inundated east of La Salle. High water levels begin to impact shipping interests along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CST Friday the stage was 21.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CST Friday was 22.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Monday morning and continue falling to 18.4 feet later in the week. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 24 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 24 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. River rises are being affected by snow melt from very warm temperatures. Changes to the temperature forecast may cause changes to the river forecast. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected around 11 PM CST this evening.
